intro: Treubella signata, commonly known as the spotted treubella, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Treubella signata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
